title: Noetherian ring
summary: In mathematics, a Noetherian ring is a ring that satisfies the ascending chain condition on left and right ideals; if the chain condition is satisfied only for left ideals or for right ideals, then the ring is said left-Noetherian or right-Noetherian respectively. That is, every increasing sequence I 1 ⊆ I 2 ⊆ I 3 ⊆ ⋯ {\displaystyle I_{1}\subseteq I_{2}\subseteq I_{3}\subseteq \cdots } of left (or right) ideals has a largest element; that is, there exists an n such that: I n = I n + 1 = ⋯ . {\displaystyle I_{n}=I_{n+1}=\cdots .}
